intro: Cyclosorus diversilobus, commonly known as the variable lobed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive thallus structure with a dense, leafy growth pattern and is characterized by its varied leaf lobes. Its reproductive structures, including both male and female gametophytes, are typically found on the surface of the thallus. Cyclosorus diversilobus plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
